com.stephentuso.welcome

Class FullscreenParallaxPage

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.stephentuso.welcome.WelcomePage<FullscreenParallaxPage>
      • com.stephentuso.welcome.FullscreenParallaxPage

  • public class FullscreenParallaxPage
extends WelcomePage<FullscreenParallaxPage>
    A page that applies a parallax effect to the supplied layout. The speed at which the children are moved is determined by their location in the layout, the first will move the slowest and the last will move the fastest, or the opposite, if the parallax factors are reversed. See documentation for the parallax factor methods for more details. Created by stephentuso on 10/12/16.

        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • firstParallaxFactor

        public FullscreenParallaxPage firstParallaxFactor(float factor)
        The factor that the first item in the layout should move, relative to the movement of the page. The factors for items between the first and last will be evenly distributed between the first and last parallax factors. If a = page offset; x = parallax factor item offset = a + ax Meaning the following values will have these results: -1: Completely stationary 0: Same speed as page 1: Twice as fast as page Default: 0.2
        Parameters:
        factor - The parallax factor for the first item in the layout
        Returns:
        This FullscreenParallaxPage object to allow method calls to be chained

      • lastParallaxFactor

        public FullscreenParallaxPage lastParallaxFactor(float factor)
        The factor that the last item in the layout should move, relative to the movement of the page. The factors for items between the first and last will be evenly distributed between the first and last parallax factors. If a = page offset; x = parallax factor item offset = a + ax Meaning the following values will have these results: -1: Completely stationary 0: Same speed as page 1: Twice as fast as page Default: 1
        Parameters:
        factor - The parallax factor for the first item in the layout
        Returns:
        This FullscreenParallaxPage object to allow method calls to be chained

      • recursive

        public FullscreenParallaxPage recursive(boolean recursive)
        Whether or not the parallax effect should be recursive. If false, ViewGroups will be treated as a single item, and their children will move at the same speed. If true, the parallax effect will be applied to ViewGroup children individually.
        Parameters:
        recursive - Whether or not the effect should be recursive (travel through ViewGroups)
        Returns:
        This FullscreenParallaxPage object to allow method calls to be chained

        public Fragment fragment()
